title: BRIEF-Forever 21, Its U.S. Subsidiaries Commenced Voluntary Chapter 11 Cases In U.S. Bankruptcy Court
text:
© Reuters. BRIEF-Forever 21, Its U.S. Subsidiaries Commenced Voluntary Chapter 11 Cases In U.S. Bankruptcy Court

Sept 29 (Reuters) - FOREVER 21, INC:

* TO IMPLEMENT GLOBAL RESTRUCTURING TO FOCUS ON PROFITABLE FOOTPRINT

* FOREVER 21, INC - COMPANY OBTAINS $350 MILLION IN FINANCING TO FACILITATE RESTRUCTURING

* FOREVER 21- COMPANY PLANS TO EXIT MOST OF ITS INTERNATIONAL LOCATIONS IN ASIA AND EUROPE, BUT WILL CONTINUE OPERATIONS IN MEXICO AND LATIN AMERICA

* FOREVER 21 - INTENDS TO USE PROCEEDINGS TO FACILITATE GLOBAL RESTRUCTURING THAT WILL ALLOW CO TO FOCUS ON A PROFITABLE CORE PART OF ITS OPERATIONS

* FOREVER 21- TO FACILITATE RESTRUCTURING, CO HAS OBTAINED $275 MILLION FINANCING FROM ITS EXISTING LENDERS WITH JPMORGAN CHASE BANK, N.A. AS AGENT

* FOREVER 21- CO ANNOUNCED IT, ITS U.S. SUBSIDIARIES HAVE COMMENCED VOLUNTARY CHAPTER 11 CASES IN UNITED STATES BANKRUPTCY COURT FOR DISTRICT OF DELAWARE

* FOREVER 21- CO , ITS CANADIAN SUBSIDIARY GRANTED PROTECTION UNDER COMPANIES' CREDITORS ARRANGEMENT ACT BY ONTARIO SUPERIOR COURT OF JUSTICE IN TORONTO
